alert.note: Alert for Gallatin; Hardin (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 05 at 9:44AM CST until January 12 at 3:36PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... Kentucky...Illinois... Ohio River at Mount Vernon affecting Union, Posey, Henderson and Vanderburgh Counties. Ohio River at Shawneetown affecting Union, Crittenden, Hardin and Gallatin Counties. Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam affecting Union and Posey Counties. Ohio River at Newburgh Dam affecting Vanderburgh, Daviess, Warrick, Spencer and Henderson Counties. .Water will continue to be routed into the Ohio River from rainfall that occurred last week. This will keep several points along the lower Ohio in minor flooding this weekend and into next week. For the Ohio River...including Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown, Golconda...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Shawneetown. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon, March 12th * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 35.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 40.3 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning, March 12th. - Flood stage is 33.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
